00030 NearestNeighborFLANN::NearestNeighborFLANN() {
00031         this->dimension = -1;
00032         this->maxDistance = -1; //default = disable
00033         this->dataMatrix = NULL;
00034         this->index_id = NULL;
00035 
00036         this->parameters.log_level = LOG_NONE;
00037         this->parameters.log_destination = NULL;
00038 
00039         this->parameters.algorithm = KDTREE;
00040         this->parameters.checks = 32;
00041         this->parameters.trees = 8;
00042         this->parameters.branching = 32;
00043         this->parameters.iterations = 7;
00044         this->parameters.target_precision = -1;
00045 }

00047 NearestNeighborFLANN::~NearestNeighborFLANN() {
00048         flann_free_index(index_id, &parameters);
00049 }

00051 void NearestNeighborFLANN::setData(vector<vector<float> >* data) {
00052         assert(false); //TODO: implement

00054 
00055 void NearestNeighborFLANN::setData(vector<vector<double> >* data) {
00056         assert(data != 0);
00057 
00058         if (index_id != 0) { // clean up if previous versions exist
00059                 flann_free_index(index_id, &parameters);
00060         }
00061 
00062         dimension = (*data)[0].size();
00063         rows = data->size();
00064         cols = dimension;
00065 
00066         dataMatrix = new float[rows * cols];
00067 
00068         // convert data
00069         int matrixIndex = 0;
00070         for (int rowIndex = 0; rowIndex < rows; ++rowIndex) {
00071                 for (int j = 0; j < dimension; ++j) {
00072                         dataMatrix[matrixIndex + j] = static_cast<float> ( (*data)[rowIndex][j] );
00073                 }
00074                 matrixIndex += dimension;
00075         }
00076 
00077         // create underlying data structure
00078         index_id = flann_build_index(dataMatrix, rows, cols, &speedup, &parameters);
00079 }
00080 
00081 void NearestNeighborFLANN::setData(PointCloud3D* data) {
00082         assert(data != 0);
00083 
00084         if (index_id != 0) { // clean up if previous versions exist
00085                 flann_free_index(index_id, &parameters);
00086         }
00087 
00088         dimension = 3; //we work with a 3D points...
00089         rows = data->getSize();
00090         cols = dimension;
00091 
00092         dataMatrix = new float[rows * cols];
00093 
00094         // convert data
00095         int matrixIndex = 0;
00096         for (int rowIndex = 0; rowIndex < rows; ++rowIndex) {
00097                 dataMatrix[matrixIndex + 0] = static_cast<float> ((*data->getPointCloud())[rowIndex].getX());
00098                 dataMatrix[matrixIndex + 1] = static_cast<float> ((*data->getPointCloud())[rowIndex].getY());
00099                 dataMatrix[matrixIndex + 2] = static_cast<float> ((*data->getPointCloud())[rowIndex].getZ());
00100                 matrixIndex += 3;
00101         }
00102 
00103         // create underlying data structure
00104         index_id = flann_build_index(dataMatrix, rows, cols, &speedup, &parameters);
00105 
00106 }

00109         assert(false); //TODO: implement

00112 void NearestNeighborFLANN::findNearestNeighbors(vector<double>* query, std::vector<int>* resultIndices, unsigned int k) {
00113         assert (query != 0);
00114         assert (resultIndices != 0);
00115 //      assert (static_cast<int>(query->size()) == dimension);
00116 
00117         if (static_cast<int>(query->size()) != dimension) {
00118                 throw runtime_error("Mismatch of query and data dimension.");
00119         }
00120         if (static_cast<int>(k) > this->rows) {
00121                 throw runtime_error("Number of neighbors k is bigger than the amount of data points.");
00122         }
00123 
00124         resultIndices->clear();
00125         int nn = static_cast<int>(k);
00126         int tcount = 1;
00127         int* result = new int[nn];
00128         float* dists = new float[nn];
00129 
00130         float* queryData = new float[dimension]; //TODO: is there also a double version?!?
00131         for (int i = 0; i < dimension; ++i) {
00132                 queryData[i] = static_cast<float>( (*query)[i] );
00133         }
00134 
00135         flann_find_nearest_neighbors_index(index_id, queryData, tcount, result, dists, nn, parameters.checks, &parameters);
00136 
00137         brics_3d::Coordinate resultDistance; //distance has same data-type as Coordinate, although the meaning is different TODO: global distance typedef?
00138         int resultIndex;
00139         for (int i = 0; i < nn; i++) {
00140                 resultDistance = static_cast<brics_3d::Coordinate>(sqrt(dists[i])); //seems to return squared distance (although documentation does not suggest)
00141                 resultIndex = result[i];
00142                 if (resultDistance <= maxDistance || maxDistance < 0.0) { //if max distance is < 0 then the distance should have no influence
00143                         resultIndices->push_back(resultIndex);
00144                 }
00145         }
00146 
00147         delete[] queryData;
00148         delete[] dists;
00149         delete[] result;
00150 }
00151 
00152 void NearestNeighborFLANN::findNearestNeighbors(Point3D* query, std::vector<int>* resultIndices, unsigned int k) {
00153         assert (query != 0);
00154         assert (resultIndices != 0);
00155         assert (dimension == 3);
00156 
00157         if (static_cast<int>(k) > this->rows) {
00158                 throw runtime_error("Number of neighbors k is bigger than the amount of data points.");
00159         }
00160 
00161         resultIndices->clear();
00162         int nn = static_cast<int>(k);
00163         int tcount = 1;
00164         int* result = new int[nn];
00165         float* dists = new float[nn];
00166 
00167         float* queryData = new float[dimension];
00168         queryData[0] = static_cast<float> (query->getX());
00169         queryData[1] = static_cast<float> (query->getY());
00170         queryData[2] = static_cast<float> (query->getZ());
00171 
00172         flann_find_nearest_neighbors_index(index_id, queryData, tcount, result, dists, nn, parameters.checks, &parameters);
00173 
00174         brics_3d::Coordinate resultDistance; //distance has same data-type as Coordinate, although the meaning is different TODO: global distance typedef?
00175         int resultIndex;
00176         for (int i = 0; i < nn; i++) {
00177                 resultDistance = static_cast<brics_3d::Coordinate>(sqrt(dists[i])); //seems to return squared distance (although documentation does not suggest)
00178                 resultIndex = result[i];
00179                 if (resultDistance <= maxDistance || maxDistance < 0.0) { //if max distance is < 0 then the distance should have no influence
00180                         resultIndices->push_back(resultIndex);
00181                 }
00182         }
00183 
00184         delete[] queryData;
00185         delete[] dists;
00186         delete[] result;
00187 }
